intro: Kochia angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf Russian spinach, is a flowering plant native to Eurasia. It is characterized by its upright, branching stems and lance-shaped, blue-green leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Kochia angustifolia is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is also cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to tolerate drought.
